content.description: Stand start with your choice of hold. From there, climb straight up between the two vertical seams to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is sloping and has a rock near it, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Behemoth's south face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched in the hueco. From there, gain and match hands on the generous rail above, set the feet, fire to a right hand edge before the lip, then use the bumps to mantel onto the slab, and finish up the remainder.
content.protection: At least two to three pads. The immediate landing is decent, but there are rocks surrounding the problem, and the landing is uneven.
content.location:
It climbs the north face of Behemoth, just to the right of

Soy Bomb

. Basically, this is a variation of

Soy Bomb

that doesn't use the aretes.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched in the hueco. From there, pull to a pair of right hand edges, gain the left hand gaston-rail with the left, follow to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. It has a great landing.
content.location:
It climbs between

Pokerwork

and

Elite Delete

on Behemoth's northeast face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on bumps on the arete. From there, bump up through a pair of sidepulls, gain the circular edge on the face, then a great left hand sidepull on the arete, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the east side of Behemoth's southeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand at the hueco on the face. From there, move with a right hand to the generous rail on the face, bump the left hand up the arete to a sidepull-pinch, gain the right hand edge before the lip on the face, then use the bumps to mantel onto the highly-featured slab for the finish.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is decent, but there are rocks surrounding the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the north arete on Behemoth.

content.description:
Sit start with a left hand sloper-sidepull and a right hand incut crimp. From there, pull up through the small edges to reach an easy mantel.

The large shelf to the left of the problem is off.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is great.
content.location:
It climbs the southernmost section of Behemoth's northeast face section. Just to the left of

Sleep Is the Code Word

.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the three-sided edge shield. From there, reach the deep vertical slit with the left hand, use a pair of edges with the right hand, follow to the hueco at the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is very good on this one, but there are some rocks behind the fall zone.
content.location:
It climbs between

Sleep Is the Code Word

and

Little Digger

on Behemoth's northeast face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge on the arete and a left hand sidepull. From there, bump the right hand up to a great sidepull on the arete, gain a better sidepull with a left hand on the face, then continue up through a series of edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a rock bordering the right fall zone, and there are some benign rocks behind the problem as well.
content.location: It climbs to the right of Elite Delete on Behemoth's northeast face.
